TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit Help extends System.Object

remarks.format:
## Remarks You cannot create a new instance of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Help> class. To provide Help for an application, call the static <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Help.ShowHelp%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Help.ShowHelpIndex%2A> methods.
You can use <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Help> to show compiled Help files (.chm) or HTML files in the HTML Help format. Compiled Help files provide a table of contents, an index, search capability, and keyword links in pages. Shortcuts work only in compiled Help files.
You can generate HTML Help 1.x files by using HTML Help Workshop. For more information about HTML Help, see "HTML Help Workshop" and other HTML Help topics at [Microsoft HTML Help](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=178661).
## Examples The following code example displays a form that contains three buttons that can be used to interact with the Mspaint.chm Help file. The **Show Help Index** button displays the **Index** tab for the Help file. The **Show Help** button displays content in the Help file based on the value that is selected in the **Help Navigator** list. The **Show Keyword** button displays content in the Help file based on the keyword that is specified in the **Keyword** text box.
For example, to show the Ovals Help page by the index value, select the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.HelpNavigator?displayProperty=fullName> value in the **Help Navigator** drop-down list, type **ovals** in the **Parameter** text box, and then click the **Show Help** button. To show the "To paint with a brush" Help topic by the keyword, type **mspaint.chm::/paint_brush.htm** in the **Keyword** text box, and then click the **Show Keyword** button.
The example uses the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Help.ShowHelp%2A> method to display the different Help tabs and Help topics, and the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Help.ShowHelpIndex%2A> method to display the Help index.
[!code-cpp[System.Windows.Forms.Help#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.Help/CPP/helpsnippet.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Windows.Forms.Help#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.Help/CS/helpsnippet.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.Help#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.Help/VB/helpsnippet.vb#1)]

The path and name of the Help file.
Docs.summary: Displays the contents of the Help file at the specified URL.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The `url` parameter can be of the form C:\path\sample.chm or /folder/file.htm.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Help.ShowHelp%2A> method. To run this example, paste the following code into a form that contains a button named `Button1`.

MemberSignature.Value: public static void ShowHelp (System.Windows.Forms.Control parent, string url, string keyword);
.method public static hidebysig void ShowHelp(class System.Windows.Forms.Control parent, string url, string keyword) cil managed

The path and name of the Help file.
The keyword to display Help for.
Docs.summary: Displays the contents of the Help file found at the specified URL for a specific keyword.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The `url` parameter can be of the form C:\path\sample.chm or /folder/file.htm.
If you provide the keyword `null`, the table of contents for the Help file will be displayed.
## Examples The following code example displays a form with three buttons that can be used to interact with the mspaint.chm Help file. The **Show Help Index** button displays the **Index** tab for the Help file. The **Show Help** button displays content in the Help file based on the value that is selected in the **Help Navigator** list. The **Show Keyword** button displays content in the Help file based on the keyword that is specified in the **Keyword** text box.
For example, to show the Ovals Help page by the index value, select the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.HelpNavigator?displayProperty=fullName> value in the **Help Navigator** drop-down list, type **ovals** in the **Parameter** text box, and then click the **Show Help** button. To show the "To paint with a brush" Help topic by the keyword, type **mspaint.chm::/paint_brush.htm** in the **Keyword** text box, and then click the **Show Keyword** button.
This example shows only the call to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Help.ShowHelp%2A> method. See the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Help> class overview for the complete code example.

MemberSignature.Value: public static void ShowHelp (System.Windows.Forms.Control parent, string url, System.Windows.Forms.HelpNavigator navigator);
.method public static hidebysig void ShowHelp(class System.Windows.Forms.Control parent, string url, valuetype System.Windows.Forms.HelpNavigator navigator) cil managed

Docs.param: A that identifies the parent of the Help dialog box.
The path and name of the Help file.
Docs.summary: Displays the contents of the Help file found at the specified URL for a specific topic.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The `url` parameter can be of the form C:\path\sample.chm or /folder/file.htm.
Compiled Help files provide table of contents, index, search, and keyword links in pages. You can use the following values for the `navigator` parameter: <xref:System.Windows.Forms.HelpNavigator.TableOfContents>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.HelpNavigator.Find>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.HelpNavigator.Index>, or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.HelpNavigator.Topic>.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Help.ShowHelp%2A> method to open a Help file to its index page. To run this example, paste the following code into a form that contains a button named `Button2`.
[!code-cpp[System.Windows.Forms.HelpExample#2](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.HelpExample/CPP/form1.cpp#2)] [!code-csharp[System.Windows.Forms.HelpExample#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.HelpExample/CS/form1.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.HelpExample#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.HelpExample/VB/form1.vb#2)]

MemberSignature.Value: public static void ShowHelp (System.Windows.Forms.Control parent, string url, System.Windows.Forms.HelpNavigator command, object parameter);
.method public static hidebysig void ShowHelp(class System.Windows.Forms.Control parent, string url, valuetype System.Windows.Forms.HelpNavigator command, object parameter) cil managed

Docs.param: A that identifies the parent of the Help dialog box.
The path and name of the Help file.
A string that contains the topic identifier.
Docs.summary: Displays the contents of the Help file located at the URL supplied by the user.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Compiled Help files provide table-of-contents, index, search, and keyword links in pages. You can use the `param` parameter to provide additional refinement of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.HelpNavigator.Topic>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.HelpNavigator.TopicId>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.HelpNavigator.KeywordIndex>, or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.HelpNavigator.AssociateIndex> command. If the value specified in the `command` parameter is <xref:System.Windows.Forms.HelpNavigator.TableOfContents>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.HelpNavigator.Index>, or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.HelpNavigator.Find>, this value should be an `empty string`. If the `command` parameter references <xref:System.Windows.Forms.HelpNavigator.Topic>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.HelpNavigator.TopicId>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.HelpNavigator.KeywordIndex>, or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.HelpNavigator.AssociateIndex>, this value should be a string that contains the topic name, or the keyword or numeric identifier of the topic to display.
The `url` parameter can be of the form C:\path\sample.chm or /folder/file.htm.
## Examples The following code example displays a form with three buttons that can be used to interact with the mspaint.chm Help file. The **Show Help Index** button displays the **Index** tab for the Help file. The **Show Help** button displays content in the Help file based on the value that is selected in the **Help Navigator** list. The **Show Keyword** button displays content in the Help file based on the keyword that is specified in the **Keyword** text box.
For example, to show the Ovals Help page by the index value, select the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.HelpNavigator?displayProperty=fullName> value in the **Help Navigator** drop-down list, type **ovals** in the **Parameter** text box, and then click the **Show Help** button. To show the "To paint with a brush" Help topic by the keyword, type **mspaint.chm::/paint_brush.htm** in the **Keyword** text box, and then click the **Show Keyword** button.
This example shows only the call to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Help.ShowHelp%2A> method. See the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Help> class overview for the complete code example.
[!code-cpp[System.Windows.Forms.Help#3](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.Help/CPP/helpsnippet.cpp#3)] [!code-csharp[System.Windows.Forms.Help#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.Help/CS/helpsnippet.cs#3)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.Help#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.Help/VB/helpsnippet.vb#3)]

remarks.format:
